properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoky Skies Bulletin - October 2, 2020 These regions of BC are being impacted or are likely to be impacted by wildfire smoke over the next 24-32 hours. Smoke from wildfires in the US is affecting air quality in the region and has caused an increase in fine particulate matter (PM2.5) concentrations. This event will be short in duration and less intense than the previous event in September. Widespread haze and moderate Air Quality Health Index (AQHI) levels are expected to continue until Sunday, when a change in weather will likely develop and clear out the smoke. The next bulletin update will be available October 04, 2020. The bulletin can be accessed online at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air/air-quality/air-advisories ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-10-03T16:42:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-10-03T00:43:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1064864495.2020
Area: Sunshine Coast - Gibsons to Earls Cove, Whistler, Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in areas prone to frost early Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Patchy frost is expected Saturday morning as overnight temperatures dip near or below the freezing mark. Cloud cover may prevent the formation of frost in some areas, however, under clear skies, temperatures may have the ability to dip cold enough for frost to form. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. Further rainfall: 5 to 10 mm. Locations: northern Avalon Peninsula. Time span: continuing until midday today. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-03T17:07:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-03T08:03:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1471533486.2020
Area: Avalon Peninsula North, St. John's and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
